definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)

sentences.english: Your constant criticism has deadened their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 你接二連三地批評降低了他們的熱情。

sentences.english: He's getting barraged with new scripts every month from filmmakers across Asia.
sentences.chinese: 他每月都會接二連三地接到來自亞洲製片人的新劇本。

sentences.english: Teddy: Yes. Because whenever mama bear comes out of her cave, bad things happen.
sentences.chinese: 因爲只要暴走熊媽媽出洞，壞事就會接二連三地發生。

sentences.english: Shortly thereafter, financial institutions hit the skids in rapid succession.
sentences.chinese: 此後不久，金融機構接二連三地出現觸礁。

sentences.english: Their company suffered loss on loss in business last year.
sentences.chinese: 他們公司去年在生意上接二連三地虧本。

sentences.english: And send a region more in this accident, most bloodcurdling experience in quick succession comes over.
sentences.chinese: 而在這個事故多發地帶，最恐怖的經歷接二連三襲來。

sentences.english: The rapid succession of trials is one of the sorest tests of faith.
sentences.chinese: 這些接二連三的試煉，是對我們信心的考驗。

sentences.english: Repeated batterings on the rocks had staved in one side of the boat.
sentences.chinese: 接二連三的撞擊礁石使船的一邊撞了一個洞。

sentences.english: Repeatedly, the Bible says to "serve the Lord with all your heart.
sentences.chinese: 聖經上接二連三的要我們“盡心盡意的侍奉主”。

sentences.english: THE RECHECKS WERE eating Nick alive.
sentences.chinese: 接二連三的返修簡直活活要了尼克的命。

sentences.english: Whether to cope with successive, customer audits from time to time to worry?
sentences.chinese: 是否在爲應對接二連三，不定期的客戶驗廠而煩惱？
請不要再接二連三地提問題了。

sentences.english: The quick succession of strokes is what causes the lightning channel to flicker.
sentences.chinese: 接二連三的快速閃擊，則是使閃電通道閃爍的主因。

sentences.english: Fortunately, I picked winners back to back in the last few races.
sentences.chinese: 我很走運，在最後幾場馬賽中，接二連三地賭贏了。

sentences.english: He also began a running feud with Dean Acheson.
sentences.chinese: 他也開始接二連三地和艾奇遜院長髮生爭執。

sentences.english: Dennis and Eckhardt peppered Cavallo with questions.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯和埃克哈特接二連三地提問。

definition: more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
terrorist attack (abbr. for 恐怖襲擊|恐怖袭击[kong3 bu4 xi2 ji1])
to come one after the other
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
